intro: Plectranthus malvinus, commonly known as the New Zealand mint, is a perennial herb native to New Zealand. It features aromatic, lance-shaped leaves with a minty scent, and its flowers are typically violet or purple in color. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and as a source of essential oils. Plectranthus malvinus is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional Māori medicine.
